content.json: # PSRule - For Azure Workbook PSRule for Azure scans Azure Infrastructure as Code (IaC) templates/modules and evaluates the state of the templates (`Bicep` and `ARM`) against the Azure Well-Architected Framework. To see any data information must be ingested into an Azure Monitor Log Analytics Workspace. For instructions on setup please see [Setup Azure Monitor logs](https://aka.ms/ps-rule-azure/monitor). For information on the rules that are being Assessed click [here](https://azure.github.io/PSRule.Rules.Azure/en/rules/).

content.query:
PSRule_CL
| project org_parsed=split(RunId_s, '/')
| extend organisation = tostring(org_parsed[0])
| distinct organisation
| summarize count()
content.title: ADO/Github - Orgs

content.query:
PSRule_CL
| project CorrelationId
| distinct CorrelationId
| summarize count()
content.title: Total - Pipeline Runs

content.query:
PSRule_CL
| project TargetName_s
| distinct TargetName_s
| summarize Bicep = countif(TargetName_s contains '.bicep')
content.title: Total - Bicep Modules

content.query:
PSRule_CL
| project TargetName_s
| distinct TargetName_s
| summarize ARM = countif(TargetName_s endswith 'template.json')
content.title: Total - ARM Templates

content.query:
PSRule_CL
| project Outcome_s, TargetName_s
| where TargetName_s !endswith 'parameters.json'
| summarize count() by Outcome_s
content.title: Total - Rules Assessedby Results

content.query:
PSRule_CL
| project Annotations_s, Outcome_s, TargetName_s
| where TargetName_s !endswith 'parameters.json'
| where Annotations_s != ""
| extend annotations=parsejson(Annotations_s)
| summarize Total = count(), Pass = countif(Outcome_s == "Pass"), Fail = countif(Outcome_s == "Fail")  by Pillars = tostring(annotations.pillar)
content.title: Outcomes by Pillar

content.query:
PSRule_CL
| project Annotations_s, TargetName_s
| where Annotations_s != ""
| where TargetName_s !endswith '.json' and TargetName_s !endswith '.bicep'
| extend annotations=parsejson(Annotations_s)
| summarize count() by tostring(annotations.severity)
content.title: Total Severities by Resources

content.query:
PSRule_CL
| project Annotations_s, TargetName_s, TargetType_s
| where Annotations_s != ""
| where TargetName_s !endswith '.json' and TargetName_s !endswith '.bicep'
| extend annotations=parsejson(Annotations_s)
| extend online_version_ = tostring(parse_json(Annotations_s).["online version"])
| summarize by Resource = TargetName_s, ResourceType = TargetType_s, Severity = tostring(annotations.severity), Pillar = tostring(annotations.pillar), Recommendation = online_version_
content.title: Severities By Resources - Detailed

content.json:
# Maturity Over Time

The following tables visualize the results over time. This can be useful to:

- Understand growth of the IAC repository
- Failed outcomes over time (how frequently are templates failing assessments)
- Transition from ARM to Bicep modules

content.query:
PSRule_CL
| project Outcome_s, TimeGenerated, TargetName_s
| where TargetName_s !endswith 'parameters.json'
| summarize count() by Outcome_s, bin(TimeGenerated, 1h)
content.title: Outcomes - Overtime

content.query:
PSRule_CL
| project TargetName_s, TimeGenerated
| distinct TargetName_s, TimeGenerated
| summarize ARM = countif (TargetName_s endswith 'template.json'), Bicep = countif (TargetName_s endswith '.bicep') by bin(TimeGenerated, 24h)
//| summarize dcount(TargetName_s)
content.title: IAC Type Assessed - Overtime

content.json:
# Resource Types

Insights into the type of IAC Templates that are scanned / availabile in these IAC repositories.

content.query:
PSRule_CL
| project TargetType_s, TimeGenerated, TargetName_s
| where TargetName_s !endswith '.json' and TargetName_s !endswith '.bicep'
| summarize by ResourceType = TargetType_s
| distinct ResourceType
| order by ResourceType desc
//| summarize count() by TargetName_s, bin(TimeGenerated, 24h)
content.title: ResourceTypes Assessed

content.query:
PSRule_CL
| project TargetType_s, TargetName_s, TimeGenerated
| where TargetName_s !endswith '.json' and TargetName_s !endswith '.bicep'
| distinct TargetType_s, TimeGenerated
| summarize count() by ResourceType = TargetType_s, bin(TimeGenerated, 24h)
content.title: Resources Assessed By Resource Type - Overtime

content.json:
# Well Architected Framework - Pillar Maturity

The following panels display detailed information about the maturity of the Infrastructure As Code scanned by PSRule for Azure by Pillar.

# {selectedTab} - Pillar The {selectedTab} Pillar provides guidance around governing costs of resources in the Cloud. This includes checklists, principals and tradeoffs. For more information about this pillar: - [Well-Archited Framework - {selectedTab}](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/architecture/framework/#cost-optimization) - [PSRule for Azure {selectedTab} Rules](https://azure.github.io/PSRule.Rules.Azure/en/rules/module/#cost-optimization)

# {selectedTab} - Pillar The {selectedTab} Pillar provides guidance around building highly resiliency solutions in Azure. It details recommendations for different services and best practices for ensuring solutions are as resilient as possible. For more information about this pillar: - [Well-Archited Framework - {selectedTab}](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/architecture/framework/resiliency) - [PSRule for Azure {selectedTab} Rules](https://azure.github.io/PSRule.Rules.Azure/en/rules/module/#reliability)

# {selectedTab} - Pillar The {selectedTab} Pillar provides guidance and best practices for securing resources running in Azure. It details recommendations for different services and checklists to increase the security of a solution. For more information about this pillar: - [Well-Archited Framework - {selectedTab}](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/architecture/framework/security/) - [PSRule for Azure {selectedTab} Rules](https://azure.github.io/PSRule.Rules.Azure/en/rules/module/#security)

# {selectedTab} - Pillar The {selectedTab} Pillar provides guidance and best practices for optimising a solution for performance. This includes tips for horizontally scaling and which services to pick for the best performance. For more information about this pillar: - [Well-Archited Framework - {selectedTab}](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/architecture/framework/scalability/) - [PSRule for Azure {selectedTab} Rules](https://azure.github.io/PSRule.Rules.Azure/en/rules/module/#performance-efficiency)

# {selectedTab} - Pillar The {selectedTab} Pillar provides guidance on operational excellency. For more information about this pillar: - [Well-Archited Framework - {selectedTab}](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/architecture/framework/devops/) - [PSRule for Azure {selectedTab} Rules](https://azure.github.io/PSRule.Rules.Azure/en/rules/module/#operational-excellence)

# Rules Assessed

These are the PSRule for Azure rules for the pillar {selectedTab} that were scanned.

content.query:
PSRule_CL
| project Annotations_s, Outcome_s
| extend annotations=parsejson(Annotations_s)
| where annotations.pillar == "{selectedTab}"
| summarize count() by Outcome_s
content.title: Total - Rules assessed by result

content.query:
PSRule_CL
| project Annotations_s, Outcome_s, TimeGenerated
| extend annotations=parsejson(Annotations_s)
| where annotations.pillar == "{selectedTab}"
| extend annotations=parsejson(Annotations_s)
| summarize count() by Outcome_s, bin(TimeGenerated, 1h)
content.title: Outcomes - Overtime

content.json:
# Outcomes By Severity

There's 3 severity levels PSRule will alert on:

- **Critical:**
- **Important:**
- **Awareness:**

content.query:
PSRule_CL
| project Annotations_s
| where Annotations_s != ""
| extend annotations=parsejson(Annotations_s)
| where annotations.pillar == "{selectedTab}"
| extend annotations=parsejson(Annotations_s)
| summarize count() by tostring(annotations.severity)
content.title: Total - By Severity

content.query:
PSRule_CL
| project Annotations_s, TimeGenerated
| where Annotations_s != ""
| extend annotations=parsejson(Annotations_s)
| where annotations.pillar == "{selectedTab}"
| extend annotations=parsejson(Annotations_s)
| summarize count() by tostring(annotations.severity), bin(TimeGenerated, 1h)
content.title: Total - By Severity

content.json:
# Outcomes By Category

Each rule that is scanned is categorised. This provides additional insights into the template maturity.

content.query:
PSRule_CL
| project Annotations_s, Outcome_s
| extend annotations=parsejson(Annotations_s)
| where annotations.pillar == "{selectedTab}"
| summarize Total = count(), Pass = countif(Outcome_s == "Pass"), Fail = countif(Outcome_s == "Fail") by tostring(annotations.category)
| order by Total
content.title: Outcomes by Category

content.query:
PSRule_CL
| project Annotations_s, Outcome_s, TimeGenerated
| extend annotations=parsejson(Annotations_s)
| where annotations.pillar == "{selectedTab}"
| summarize Total = count() by tostring(annotations.category), bin(TimeGenerated, 1h)
| order by Total
content.title: Outcomes by Category

content.json:
# Detailed Analysis

The panels to the right provides a deep dive into the telemetry by severity. This allows you to examine the specific recommendations for each resource and each IAC template / module.

content.query:
PSRule_CL
| project Annotations_s, TargetName_s, TargetType_s
| where Annotations_s != ""
| where TargetName_s !endswith '.json' and TargetName_s !endswith '.bicep'
| extend annotations=parsejson(Annotations_s)
| where annotations.pillar == "{selectedTab}"
| extend online_version_ = tostring(parse_json(Annotations_s).["online version"])
| summarize by Resource = TargetName_s, ResourceType = TargetType_s, Severity =  tostring(annotations.severity), tostring(annotations.category), Recommendation = online_version_
content.title: Resources by Severity

content.query:
PSRule_CL
| project Annotations_s, TargetName_s, TargetType_s
| where Annotations_s != ""
| where TargetName_s endswith '.json' or TargetName_s endswith '.bicep'
| extend annotations=parsejson(Annotations_s)
| extend fileGitHubParse = replace_string(TargetName_s, '/home/runner/work/*/', '')
| extend fileADOParse = replace_string(fileGitHubParse, '/home/vsts/work/1/s/', '')
| extend parsedFileName = fileADOParse
| extend online_version_ = tostring(parse_json(Annotations_s).["online version"])
| where annotations.pillar == "{selectedTab}"
| summarize by File = parsedFileName, ResourceType = TargetType_s, Severity =  tostring(annotations.severity), Category = tostring(annotations.category), Recommendation = online_version_
| distinct File, Severity, Category, Recommendation
content.title: IAC Files by Severity
